(1)
67th Street, at the N.W. corner of Eighteenth Ave., showing an old frame mansion, once a hotel and later P.S. No. 188. In 1925 it was occupied by the John Hughes Council, Knights of Columbus, No. 481.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The saae, from another angle.
March 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1)
67th Street, at the N.W. corner of Eighteenth Ave., showing an old frame mansion, once a hotel and later P.S. No. 188. In 1925 it was occupied by the John Hughes Council, Knights of Columbus, No. 481.
1922.

18th Avenue (right), at the northwest corner of 67th Street, showing the old Public School No. 180. A new P. S. 180 was later erected on the east side of 16th Avenue, from 56th to 57th Streets. This house later became the quarters of John Hughes Council, Knights of Columbus, No. 481.

Board of Education of the City of New York   January 19, 1923
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE
